medical_history.chief_complaint: LLQ abdominal pain and bright red blood per rectum (BRBPR).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced LLQ abdominal pain since a date not specified. She was found on the floor with feces and blood after attempting to get up and could not remember many symptoms. The family reported intermittent fever with a maximum of 102Â°F since a date not specified. A rash has spread from the left lower abdomen to the left thigh, which has been intermittent for over a year.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Stage IIIB vulvar cancer status post cisplatin and radiation therapy, gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST) status post resection, dementia, hypertension, dyslipidemia, four squamous cell carcinomas of the lower extremity status post excision, cholecystectomy, macular degeneration, retinal detachment x2, and cataract.
medical_history.family_history: Daughter had melanoma; sister with squamous cell skin cancer. No other malignancies in the family.
medical_history.social_history: Resident of an assisted living facility, but no other specific lifestyle factors mentioned.
